message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about heat transfer. When heat is applied to a cup of cold coffee, it warms up by transferring heat energy from the heat source to the coffee. Option (A) is incorrect because a metal chair does not generate heat. Option (B) is incorrect because a flat napkin does not generate or transfer heat. Option (D) is incorrect because a wood table does not generate or transfer heat. Option (C) is the correct answer because an electrical plate generates heat and can transfer that heat to warm up the coffee.

This question requires knowledge about heat transfer. When heat is applied to a cup of cold coffee, it will warm up. Option (C) is the correct choice because an electrical plate is designed to generate heat and can be used to warm up food and beverages. Option (A) is incorrect because a metal chair does not generate heat. Option (B) is incorrect because a flat napkin does not generate heat. Option (D) is incorrect because a wood table does not generate heat.

This question requires basic knowledge about the transfer of heat. When heat is applied to a cup of cold coffee, it will warm up. Option (C) is correct because an electrical plate can provide heat energy through conduction, which will transfer heat to the cup of coffee and warm it up. Option (A) is incorrect because a metal chair does not generate heat. Option (B) is incorrect because a flat napkin does not generate heat. Option (D) is incorrect because a wood table does not generate heat.

This question requires knowledge about heat transfer. When heat is applied to a cup of cold coffee, it will warm up through conduction, which is the transfer of heat through direct contact. Option (C) is the correct answer because an electrical plate can transfer heat to the cup through conduction. Option (A) is incorrect because a metal chair would conduct heat away from the cup, cooling it further. Option (B) is incorrect because a flat napkin would not transfer heat efficiently. Option (D) is incorrect because a wood table would also not transfer heat efficiently.
